textRegions.text: How Do We Improve the Quality Reliability of Our Work?
Configured and Well Running Desktop Computers
Everything we do has a manufacturing component

notes.slide-19:
If you are creating a car engine
100 parts each with a 99% chance of being manufactured correctly there is a 37% chance of having a running engine
Keep in mind that parts are made of of parts all the way down to nuts and bolts
500 parts you have a 1% chance
notes.slide-14: 2 short or long landings at MOST major airports each day
notes.slide-26:
Examples:
+ Get as many processes using the same tools, vendors, steps as possible.
+ Limited number of desktop models
notes.slide-21: Even the act of managing has some components of manufacturing (goal setting, performance management, project planning, etc).
notes.slide-16: No power for 7 hours each month
notes.slide-22:
8-10 opportunities for defects
+ Uploading to the correct directory
+ File permissions
+ Get correct length of podcast
+ Entering in correct links, dates
+ Activating both the series and the sermon
10 x 99% = 90% correct
10 x 6 sigma = 100%
notes.slide-11: Unsafe drinking water 15 mins a day
notes.slide-3:
This is not to diminish the navy enlisted at all. 
When you want something done, you call the navy.
When you want something done right everytime you call a SEAL.
Sailors talk about about how good they are, SEALs allow others to talk about how good they are
So what do we want to be sailors or SEALs?
notes.slide-23:
A configured and imaged computer could have 20-30 opportunities for defects in the process of roll-out
20x99% = 22% having some form of defect that could require someone to call
notes.slide-12: 20,000 lost pieces of mail per hour
notes.slide-5:
How often do we drop the ball?
Someone has to remind us to do something?
An account is not set correctly?
A podcast file generates an error?
A print request isn’t moved to the correct spot.
A computer isn’t imaged correctly?
An email goes out with a broken link.
A piece of data in entered incorrectly.

Ask yourself... if I was the customer how at peace would I be when I turned in a request at it would be done on time the first time without a reminder.  Or, should I double-check their work?
notes.slide-24: Quick activity... have everyone identify a personal example
